TextView.android:text:
The department of Automobile Engineering was started in the year 1985 with a vision to create a pool of engineers with a sound knowledge of Automobile Engineering in particular to cater to the growing automotive industry. The department started with an intake of 30 and later increased to an intake of 40 students. The department was recognized as research centre form the academic year 2013-14 by VTU, Belagavi.
The strength of the department is derived from the faculties varied competencies, which includes I C Engines, Automobile Engineering, Energy Studies, Thermal power Engineering, Production Engineering, and Maintenance Engineering.
The department has teaching faculty strength of 02 Professor, 06 Associate Professor, and non-teaching faculty to assist in its activities, has 01.foreman,01 instructors, 03 Assistant Instructors, 02 mechanic’s, 2 drivers 01 SDA and 01 attender.
Department is well equipped with good lab facilities to meet program specific criteria like Auto CADD centre, Auto scanning and testing lab, Auto reconditioning lab, Automotive chassis lab, Automobile servicing lab, and Auto Electrical lab. Apart from these facilities department shares the facilities of mechanical engineering department for conducting basic mechanical sciences laboratories. .
Our Alumnus have been placed in core Automotive industries, Ancillary industries, Steel industries, Cement and Ceramic industries and Software industries ,and are occupying high positions in reputed companies both in core, multidisciplinary and software industries at national and global.
The department has students association by name auto stallion were in students organizes cultural and technical fests every year.
Department provide hearted support and guidance for producing talented and passionate engineers who will be the future of the growing Indian automotive sector.
To create technically sound and socially responsive manpower to serve automotive and related industries and society at local and global level.

The Department‘s Mission is to advance knowledge in the Automobile Engineering and allied industries by providing our students with the highest quality educational experience. The department strives to:
M1: To impart quality education through effective curriculum and good teaching practices for successful career to be a leader in chosen domain.
M2: To promote innovation through projects and other activities.
M3: To serve Automobile, allied industries and society through educational, technical and professional activities.
Department of Automobile Engineering offers 4 years BE course and the intake is 60.
Department has a VTU recognized research centre and offers Ph.D. in faculty of Automobile Engineering.

Academic Eligibility - Admission to B.E. courses: The student should have passed 2nd PUC / 12th standard or equivalent examination with English as one of the
languages and obtained 45% of marks in aggregate in Physics and Mathematics along with Chemistry / Bio-Technology / Computer Science / Electronics / Biology In case of
candidates belonging to Karnataka Scheduled Caste, Scheduled Tribe and other Backward Classes (Category I, 2A, 2B, 3A and 3B,) the minimum marks for the purpose of
eligibility will be 40% of marks in aggregate in the optional subjects in the qualifying examination.
The program educational objectives of the B.E in Automobile Engineering program at PDA College of Engineering, Kalaburagi are to produce graduates who are able to:
PEO1: To enable graduates to take up successful careers in automotive and other allied industries.
PEO2: To enable graduates to go for higher studies and provide necessary skills to conduct research activities.
PEO3: To exhibit leadership qualities, social and ethical attitudes towards society.
1. Engineering knowledge: Apply the knowledge of mathematics, science, engineering fundamentals, and an engineering specialization to the solution of complex engineering problems.

2. Problem analysis: Identify, formulate, review research literature, and analyze complex engineering problems reaching substantiated conclusions using first principles of mathematics, natural sciences, and engineering sciences.

3. Design/development of solutions: Design solutions for complex engineering problems and design system components or processes that meet the specified needs with appropriate consideration for the public health and safety, and the cultural, societal, and environmental considerations.

4. Conduct investigations of complex problems: Use research-based knowledge and research methods including design of experiments, analysis and interpretation of data, and synthesis of the information to provide valid conclusions.

5. Modern tool usage: Create, select, and apply appropriate techniques, resources, and modern engineering and IT tools including prediction and modeling to complex engineering activities with an understanding of the limitations.

6. The engineer and society: Apply reasoning informed by the contextual knowledge to assess societal, health, safety, legal and cultural issues and the consequent responsibilities relevant to the professional engineering practice.

7. Environment and sustainability: Understand the impact of the professional engineering solutions in societal and environmental contexts, and demonstrate the knowledge of, and need for sustainable development.

8. Ethics: Apply ethical principles and commit to professional ethics and responsibilities and norms of the engineering practice. 9. Individual and team work: Function effectively as an individual, and as a member or leader in diverse teams, and in multidisciplinary settings.

9. Communication: Communicate effectively on complex engineering activities with the engineering community and with society at large, such as, being able to comprehend and write effective reports and design documentation, make effective presentations, and give and receive clear instructions.

10. Project management and finance: Demonstrate knowledge and understanding of the engineering and management principles and apply these to one’s own work, as a member and leader in a team, to manage projects and in multidisciplinary environments.
11. Life-long learning: Recognize the need for, and have the preparation and ability to engage in independent and life-long learning in the broadest context of technological change.
PSO1: Apply the knowledge of engineering to analyze, design, and manufacture automotive systems / processes.
PSO2: Operate, maintain and troubleshoot automotive systems with quality assurance using state of art technology and modern tools.
PSO3: Evaluate needs of society to develop useful and creative solutions keeping in view the environment and societal concerns.

Dr. Channappa H. Biradar is presently working as Professor and Head of Automobile Engineering. He has completed BE (Mechanical) from Gulbarga University, Kalaburagi in the year 1991, M.Tech (Energy Studies) from Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi in the year 2001 and then Ph.D. from Indian Institute of Technology Delhi, New Delhi in the year 2012 in the area of alternative fuels. His research topic is “Studies on Pyrolytic Oil From Non-Edible Oil Seed Cake And Its Utilization In A Diesel Engine”. He has joined PDA College of Engineering, Kalaburagi as lecturer in the year 1992, promoted as Senior Grade Lecturer in 2006, promoted as selection grade lecturer in 2009, then promoted as Associate professor in 2012. After completion of Ph.D, Prof. Biradar is promoted as Professor in the same year. He is engaged in UG level teaching for 27 years and involved in research since 2008 to till date. He has worked as BOS member of VTU Belagavi. His efforts contributed in syllabus framing, guiding student projects. Worked as Training and placement officer for PDA college of engineering, also worked as deputy controller of Examination and Coordinator of TEQIP – III, for PDA College of engineering a autonomous institute. Currently he is guiding 4 research scholars for the award of Ph.D.
His specific areas of interests are biomass pyrolysis for production of pyrolytic oil for engine
application and utilization of pyrolised residue as an adsorbent for wastewater treatment. He
have substantial expertise on I.C. Engines, pyrolysis reactor, reactor fabrication, spectrophotometer, Atomic Absorption Spectrophotometer (AAS). He also have expertise on Various physical and chemical characterizations of biomass and fuels.
A knowledge based and computer assisted system for the Automatic generation of Process plan for prismatic parts
Prevalence of work related musculoskeleetal disorder in manufacturing Industies
Ergonomics consideration in the Design of work place in IT sector
Experimental Investigation of Performance and Emission Characteristics of TBC (Zirconia) Single cylinder 4S CI enine using methyl ester mango seed biodiesel
Studies on bio-oil derived from waste biomass through pyrolysis and its utilization in IC engine
Studies on Pyrolytic oil from seed cake and its utilization in DI Diesel engine
Production of bio-oil from algae and its utilization in Diesel engine
Experimental investigation on performance and emission

1. Chassis frames 2. Clutch assembly 3. Different types of Gearboxes 4. Propeller shaft and Differential unit 5. Steering mechanism 6. Steering gearboxes 7. Hydraulic braking system 8. Suspension system assembly
